newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London up on firm FTSE and Dow.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London up on firm FTSE and Dow.

text.p: Hong Kong shares trading in London were little changed on Wednesday but some buying of banking stocks helped push the Hang Seng London Reference Index higher, dealers said.
The index was up 29.77 points at 13,693.85 by 1508 GMT.
"We're up on the back of a firm Street and firm London," one dealer said.

"Most of the interest was in HSBC which is up around HK$1-1/2 from its Hong Kong close," he said. "There's been some buying of other banks and Hang Seng Bank 0011q.L is a bit firmer. People are thinking that if they can't get HSBC at a reasonable price they'll go on Hang Seng Bank as a kind of hedge."
The Hong Kong stock exchange will be closed for the Lunar New Year holiday on Thursday and Friday but Hong Kong shares will continue to trade in London.
The Hang Seng Index jumped 112.07 points to 13,660.50 overnight.
